p: Acute myeloid leukemia (AML) is the most common acute leukemia in adults, and incidence correlates with age. Older (>60 years) patients with AML typically have poorer prognoses and outcomes compared with younger patients, with response rates ≤50% to conventional treatments frequently reported, and few patients survive >2 years. 1, 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7, 8
